Package coffee.khyonieheart.hyacinth.option

Interface Option

All Known Implementing Classes:
None, Some
public interface Option
Represents the result of an operation in which said operation may fail or produce an unexpected result. Used as an alternative to "throws" or outright returning null, forcing handling of an operation failure, instead of potentially having a NullPointerException.

Analagous to Rust lang's Option<T> class:

https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/option/enum.Option.html#

To use an Option, call either static methods Option.some(Object contained) or Option.none().

To obtain the contained value of a SOME, call .unwrap(Class<? extends T> clazz) where T is the class to unwrap into. In the case of NONE, unwrapping will throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

As of Java 17 preview, instanceof switching is supported. 


Object contained = switch(option)
{
   case Some some -> some.unwrap(Option.class);
   case None none -> null;
};
Since:
1.0.0
Author:
Khyonie
